data.title: Android Sound Support
data.body:
Updated the Android Project so the sound classes are more inline with the rest of the platforms
Removed the Android SoundEffect.cs and Song.cs as they are no longer needed.
Updated the Sound.cs class to load the Asset using a FileDescriptor, not that you MUST dispose of the AssetDescriptor to ensure memory does not leak.
NOTE - Only mp3 seem to play at the moment, wav and ogg files will not prepare.

data.title: SpriteBatchItem optimization
data.body: The SpriteBatchItem already has allocated Vector2 's for Position and TextureCoords. The old code was creating new Vector2's for these rather than just Assigning the X and Y values to the existng properties.  As SpriteBatchItems are recycled it seemed a better idea to just reuse the exisitng allocated properties rather than re-create them each time the spritebatch item was set.

data.title: SamplerState/SpriteBatch fix
data.body:
Fix SpriteBatch not setting up SamplerState. 

Filter modes are bound to texture objects in OpenGL, in XNA/D3D they are part of sampler state objects independent of textures. This patch fixes it for SpriteBatch, which now updates filter/wrap modes on the texture object every time it binds one. I added an internal Activate() method to SamplerState to make one "active" for this purpose.

(Texture2D.generateOpenGLTexture() just sets up the object to use linear filtering and leaves it at that.)

data.title: Added Color.FromNonPremultiplied and Rectangle.Intersect functions
data.body: This update include Color.FromNonPremultiplied and Rectangle.Intersect functions. I've updated the Vector4 method and used ref function by default instead.

data.title: Added Color.FromNonPremultiplied and Rectangle.Intersect functions
data.body:
- Non Premultiplied colors are very useful for particles and pngs.
- Rectangle.Intersect will give you a difference of two intersecting rectangles

data.title: Add link to MonoGame-Samples repository
data.body: Modified README.md to include a link to the MonoGame-Samples repository as there was no other link to the repo that I could find anywhere.

data.title: Slightly refactored RenderTarget MacOS code based on PowerVR samples.
data.body:
Kenneth could you please review this and pull it in if you think it is ok. If it is not ok, let me know where I've messed up.

Thanks,

Dominique.

data.title: Fix for working out RenderTarget width and heights based on BackBuffer rather than viewport
Fix for Asset Loading on Android, Sorry for breaking it.
Changes to centralise ContentManager.cs and compressed xnbs. Still needs to be ported to Linux and Windows.
data.body: Changes to centralise ContentManager.cs and compressed xnbs. Still needs to be ported to Linux and Windows.

data.title: Android Touch events process correctly
data.body:
Return true to notify that the event has been handled, otherwise we get
strange behaviour.

Multi-Touch is still broken however and it looks like it will need quite a bit to update that.

data.title: Changes for iOS and Android GamePads
Monogame sound caching fixed (or so I believe)
data.body:
CartBlanche and all,

While debugging "Terraria linux port" to find out why sound suddenly stops playing, I just found that each time one creates a new SoundInstance, a new Sound object is created too, even when we could reuse an already created sound object available on the SoundEffect class.

I took the liberty to edit those classes and commit to my fork(they are not restricted to Linux solution, so I think it could affect everyone). Thus I can comment on the github commit page to explain why I think this change could fix the caching issue.

This change solved the Terraria port issue. Sound does not stops suddenly any more. Besides, I believe this could reduce the memory needed to play sounds and improve sound performance (allocating a new sound means reading a sound file from disc sometimes). One guy was complaining about sound lag on iOS some weeks ago on irc, I think this could be related.

I see that when you create a new sound instance, you have to set volume, pitch (and so) prior playing. There may be an issue (at least with openAL) that if two instances from a same sound are played at the same time with two different volume values, both will be played with the last volume value set. I'll try to solve it latter, as a solution isn't popping in my mind right now.

Could someone, please, take a look and see if my changes won't break the project?

Thank you.

data.title: Removed linux StarterKits
data.body: Removed linux StarterKits

data.title: Added a couple of minor missing bits of the API.
data.body:
Added missing GamePadState constructor.
Added GuideAlreadyVisibleException.

Also fixed an oddity in the release version of MonoGamerPeer.cs trying to trying to return null as a TimeStamp for SimulatedLatency.

data.title: GraphicsDeviceManager Platform changes
data.body: Make all GraphicsDeviceManager classed standard, with regard to the events.

data.title: Linux bug fixes
data.body:
Basically:
- Window resizing and fullscreen reviewed (terraria port showed me this bug)
- Texture colours were "inverted" when loading from a non xnb content - corrected that

data.title: RenderState to RasterizerState fix
data.body: I updated a Samples class that was still using RenderState to use RasterizerState instead.

data.title: Linux port (with sample revision)
data.body:
Hi. I've reviewed all samples and referenced all possible files and contents.
If you come by some other issue, please let me know.
Thank you.

data.title: Fix for leaderboard issue (iOS)
data.body:
I've fixed the issue I described here:

http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/267228
- The gestures are now enabled/disabled dynamically
- Guide disables and later reenables the gestures when showing a modal view

I also fixed an issue in MediaPlayer where the old song was disposed.

Please take a look at it.

data.title: Linux port
data.body:
Hi, the current trunk has the linux port solution. Most of the samples are running ok (except NetRumble).
Sound is working with minimal wave (not compressed) support. There is a window resizing issue (allowing and disallowing user resizing) to be solved (it seems a bug in openTK, don't know yet, I have to test it further).

data.title: Minor updates to let Android solution build
data.body: added Initialise to Guide so that it compiles for Android, updated Android DepthFormat use

data.title: rotation/scale fixes
data.body:
Ios Gamepad now works based on scale and rotation;
The Guide now rotates its view controllers.
